metadata.title: CVE-2016-5283 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla Firefox before 49.0 allows remote attackers to bypass the SameOrigin Policy via a crafted fragment identifier in the SRC attribute of anIFRAME element, leading to insufficient restrictions on link-colorinformation after a document is resized.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-5283` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0+build4-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
